intro: Landolphia parvifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and ornamental value. The flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
